abstract: A Senate bill would allow the Food and Drug Administration to force medical implant manufacturers to keep track of their devices’ performance after approval.
snippet: A Senate bill would allow the Food and Drug Administration to force medical implant manufacturers to keep track of their devices’ performance after approval.
lead_paragraph: Amid growing problems with artificial hips and other medical implants, bipartisan legislation was introduced in the Senate on Wednesday that would force manufacturers to track the performance of such products after they were approved for sale.

headline.main: Bill Would Require More Monitoring of Implants
headline.print_headline: Bill Would Require More Monitoring Of Implants
